channel.title: India Latest News: Top National Headlines Today & Breaking News | The Hindu
channel.description: National news and headlines from within or around India with live updates on major breaking events from The Hindu.

image.title: India Latest News: Top National Headlines Today & Breaking News | The Hindu

item.title: Government working for all-round development in Tripura, says Governor Indrasena Reddy
item.description: The Tripura Governor said the government has taken steps to double the income of the farmers because 70% of the population depend on the farming sector

item.title: 77th Republic Day: PM Modi's deep maroon, golden motif turban steals show
item.description: The turban with intricate embroidery had a long-flowing maroon-green tail

item.title: Dreamliners have bright future in India; expect more orders: Boeing
item.description: In India, Boeing 787 planes, also known as Dreamliners, are operated by Air India. The airline's first custom-made Dreamliner post privatisation in January 2022 is set to commence commercial operations from February 1

item.title: NSS director board decides not to go ahead with attempts to forge alliance with SNDP
item.description: The statement added that the NSS wished to maintain the same friendly relationship with the SNDP as it does with other community organisations

item.title: Pakistan keeps inflicting wounds on J&K, attempted to destroy tourism: Deputy CM Surinder Choudhary
item.description: Mr. Choudhary said people and security forces “will not allow evil designs of Pakistan to succeed” in Jammu and Kashmir

item.title: Madras High Court Chief Justice unfurls the tricolour
item.description: He also distributed certificates of appreciation to 51 High Court employees who had completed 25 years of service

item.title: Republic Day celebrated at Maharashtra Lok Bhavan
item.description: Officers and staff of Lok Bhavan, along with a platoon of the State Reserve Police Force, including police officers and jawans sang the National Anthem and saluted the flag

item.title: 467 of 1.7 lakh illegal foreigners repatriated from Assam: Governor
item.description: "A total of 467 illegal foreigners have been repatriated to their country of origin through the process of deportation," says Mr. Acharya

item.title: Actor held for allegedly raping domestic help on promise of marriage in Mumbai
item.description: Nadeem Khan allegedly raped his domestic help over a period of 10 years

item.title: Shashi Tharoor declines to comment on discussions with CPI(M) in Dubai
item.description: The Congress MP said he saw the reports during his flight to Dubai and that it would not be appropriate to comment on such matters while being in a foreign country

item.title: Eleven security personnel injured as IEDs planted by Maoists go off in Chhattisgarh
item.description: “The explosions occurred in the forests of Karregutta Hills on January 25,” a police official said

item.title: 77th Republic Day: India showcases ‘Sindoor’ valour and cultural hues
item.description: The overarching theme of the event at the Kartavya Path, the centrepiece boulevard of the national capital, was 150 years of 'Vande Mataram'

item.title: Shubhanshu Shukla, Group Captain, conferred Ashoka Chakra
item.description: The President presented the award to Shubhanshu Shukla at the Republic Day celebrations at the Kartavya Path, in New Delhi

item.title: Woman officer leads all-male CRPF contingent at Republic Day parade
item.description: The 26-year-old officer who hails from Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district led the squad of 147 personnel from the country's largest paramilitary force

item.title: Duathlon in Belagavi attracts over 250 runners
item.description: The event featured Olympic and Sprint categories, and followed the endurance-based Run–Cycle–Run format

item.title: DRI busts mephedrone factory in Satara, seizes drugs worth ₹55 crore
item.description: “The seizure included 11.848 kg of the drug in liquid form, 9.326 kg in semi-liquid form, and 738 grams in crystalline form, along with 71.5 kg of raw material capable of yielding another 15 kg of mepehdrone, collectively worth about ₹55 crore,” says official

item.title: Assam people must decide between vote bank politics and development: Himanta
item.description: “The State will go to the polls in the next few months, and people must decide whether they want to ''surrender to Bangladeshi Muslims'' or be part of progress and development”

item.title: CPI(M)-AIKS Nashik march celebrate Republic Day on the Highway from Nashik to Mumbai
item.description: It was a truly moving to see the poorest and most exploited Adivasi and other peasants of the country celebrate Republic Day in the midst of a continuing massive struggle

item.title: Republic Day celebrations in Tamil Nadu: Governor Ravi unfurls national flag
item.description: M. Kalimula of Tiruppur district received the Kottai Ameer Award.

item.title: Haveri DC receives Best District Election Officer award in Karnataka
item.description: Governor Thawar Chand Gehlot presented the award to Vijay Mahantesh Danammanavar during the National Voters’ Day celebration held in Bengaluru on January 25

item.title: Pahalgam terror attack victim among 56 awarded by Jammu and Kashmir
item.description: The recipients come from various backgrounds and have been honoured for their significant contributions in different fields, as stated in an order issued by M. Raju, Commissioner Secretary of the General Administrative Department

item.title: ‘People ignore money, religion and caste while voting in Bigg Boss reality show, but highlight them in elections to assembly or Lok Sabha’
item.description: My vote, my right basic mantra of democracy, says judge during National Voters’ Day celebration in Belagavi

item.title: Family, disciples of late folk dancer Vishwa Bandhu happy with his selection for Padma Shri
item.description: Bandhu is one of the three persons from Bihar whose names have been announced by the Central government for the Padma Awards

item.title: India to slash tariffs on cars to 40% in trade deal with EU, sources say
item.description: “Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Government has agreed to immediately reduce the tax on a limited number of cars from the 27-nation bloc with an import price of more than 15,000 euros [$17,739],” says sources

item.title: When can courts interfere in an ongoing investigation? | Explained
item.description: Should the phrase ‘coercive measures’ be defined more concretely?

item.title: 9,550 kg of explosives seized in Rajasthan, man arrested; Central agencies likely to get involved
item.description: Besides ammonium nitrate, police also seized a large quantity of explosive accessories, including nine cartons of detonators, 12 cartons and 15 bundles of blue fuse wire, and 12 cartons and five bundles of red fuse wire, officials said

item.title: Telangana’s stunning rise and its unhinged growth
item.description: However, data on this achievement point to the need for policies to be formulated to spread the fruits of growth across the State

item.title: 77th Republic Day 2026 LIVE: Military might, culture, historic firsts at Republic Day Parade
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid a wreath at the National War Memorial at the historical India Gate

item.title: Noida techie death: The road that ended in a tragedy
item.description: On a dark fog-ridden January night in Greater Noida, a water-filled construction pit — unmarked and unfenced — became a fatal trap. Yuvraj Mehta, a 27-year-old techie, accidentally drove into it and died. The incident has become more than a personal tragedy, turning into an indictment of a city built — and sold — faster than ground realities can keep pace, finds Shrimansi Kaushik. Residents say neglect and institutional apathy have turned urban spaces into landscapes of loss

item.title: 16th National Voters’ Day celebrated at Ripon Buildings
item.description: Certificates of appreciation and shields were presented to students who won competitions

item.title: HYDRAA rescues nine workers stranded in Mir Alam lake
item.description: The team was conducting surveys for the construction of the ₹319.24 crore bridge connecting Shastripuram to Chintalmet in the southern part of Hyderabad

item.title: Next generation should protect Tamil culture, learn traditional music, dance, says Muruganandam
Jammu and Kashmir CM asks people to avoid non-essential travel for 3 days amid snowfall forecast
item.description: CM Abdullah said that Jammu and Kashmir had witnessed a severe drought after December, which has now been broken.

item.title: Councillors to stage stir demanding steps to decongest Vyttila Junction
Fresh encounter breaks out between security forces, terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kishtwar
item.description: Security forces returned fire, and an intermittent exchange of gunfire was reported as the situation developed, officials said

item.title: Shibu Soren is and will forever remain 'Bharat Ratna': Jharkhand CM on Padma Bhushan to father
item.description: A statement from the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha said Shibu Soren should have been conferred with Bharat Ratna, and not Padma Bhushan, and said the demand for Bharat Ratna for him would continue to be raised

item.title: Colonel Sofiya Qureshi to be conferred with the Vishisht Sewa Medal
item.description: Some of the Ashok Chakra awardees are Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, Lieutenant General Dhiraj Seth and several others from the Army, Navy and Air Force

Rot in the ranks
item.description: Police involvement in criminal cases highlights a deeper underlying problem

item.title: Two from Tamil Nadu chosen for Padma Bhushan, 11 to receive Padma Shri
Facing opposition from VCK and outwitted by son, Ramadoss runs out of electoral options in T.N.
Assets worth over ₹30 crore seized in codeine cough syrup case
item.description: A notice of attachment has been posted on their house located in Kayastha Tola, Prahlad Ghat

item.title: UTF calls for strengthening government schools through increased enrolment
Action against BJP over PM flex boards ‘routine’, says Mayor
item.description: He said the measures were taken in accordance with strict directions issued by the Kerala High Court against the installation of illegal hoardings and flex boards in public places

item.title: Witnessing the Gaza tragedy: Dr. Santhosh Kumar’s lens captures the human cost of genocide
item.description: ‘The Last Sky,’ a photo exhibition that opened at the Fine Arts College Gallery, Palayam is open to public daily from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. till January 31. Entry is free.

item.title: PGRS cancelled in Vijayawada due to Republic Day celebrations
Five held on charge of dacoity
Deworming tablets to be distributed to more than one crore children on February 17
item.description: Children and adolescents aged between 1 and 19 will be provided ‘albendazole’ tablets free of cost, says official

item.title: Ninth edition of Kerala Literature Festival concludes
APCC seeks recovery of ₹250 crore from former TTD officials in ghee adulteration case
Krishna University to host national netball tourney for women from February 14-18
Naidupeta Urban CI, head constable caught in ACB net
‘Amaravati Bill’ will be introduced in Budget session of Parliament, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
item.description: During the Telugu Desam Parliamentary Party meeting, he advises MPs to make efforts to mobilise additional funds from the Centre, desist from picking up conflicts with Telangana on irrigation projects, and refrain from acting in a way that dents alliance’s objectives

item.title: All eyes on Governor’s address
item.description: Speaking in Mysuru, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said the Governor was free to make changes to the speech provided by the State government while delivering the Republic Day address

item.title: Every citizen should vote, strengthen democracy: Chief Secretary
Democracy bulldozed, federalism attacked: Kharge
item.description: In a speech on the eve of Republic Day, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge says federalism has become a casualty of the BJP’s ‘double-engine’ governance model, used to disadvantage Opposition-ruled States

item.title: President’s medals conferred on 33 officers from four departments
AIADMK IT Wing calls TVK chief Vijay narcissistic
item.description: It launches a sharp attack on the actor-politician over his criticism of the AIADMK being a “corrupt party” and a slave to the Central government

item.title: Eight from Karnataka to be honoured with 2026 Padma awards
Kerala State Film Awards presented
Governor, CM extend Republic Day greetings
ED files prosecution complaint against Winzo and its directors in Bengaluru
item.description: According to the ED, Winzo operated a real money gaming (RMG) platform offering over 100 games and claimed a user base of around 25 crore, largely from tier-3 and tier-4 cities

item.title: COAS General Upendra Dwivedi meets U.S. Army Secretary Daniel P. Driscoll in New Delhi
item.description: The discussions focused on deepening bilateral defence ties, expanding Army-to-Army cooperation, and reinforcing the shared commitment of both forces to global peace and security

item.title: Puneeth Kerehalli booked for spreading false claims against DG&IGP Saleem
Assembly election is a battle to defeat forces out to destroy Tamil culture, says CM Stalin
item.description: Only the DMK has the spine and courage to question the BJP-led government at the Centre that has betrayed the interests of Tamil Nadu, the DMK president says, speaking at an event organised to mark the Linguistic Martyrs’ Memorial Day at Kancheepuram

item.title: TMC, BJP supporters ‘clash’ near Kolkata; makeshift public meeting stage set afire
item.description: A makeshift stage, where former Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Deb addressed a public meeting in the afternoon, was allegedly set on fire during the clash

item.title: Attack on excise constable an assault on State authority, says Jupally Krishna Rao

Obituary | Mark Tully — BBC’s ‘voice of India’ passes away
item.description: For decades, Tully, the BBC’s India Bureau chief, chronicled the country’s defining moments.

item.title: Chinmaya Mission embodies a living tradition rooted in values: Bhatti Vikramarka
Government introducing modern Rover technology for mapping lands: Ponguleti
item.description: Licensed surveyors were being brought directly to the field-level to ensure accurate and transparent land measurements, marking a major shift in the land administration system, Minister said

item.title: Over 9,400 Bengal migrant workers leave Bengaluru amid uncertainty over SIR verification
ACB raid at Kodada labour office flags procedural lapses

item.description: He was about to receive his ninth State Award for his performance in ‘Bramayugam’ (2024), when the news arrived about him being selected for the Padma Bhushan

item.title: BJP sets up committee to draft manifesto for 2026 West Bengal Assembly polls
item.description: Union Home Minister leader Amit Shah and newly elected BJP president Nitin Nabin will visit the State in the next few days

item.title: Kalamandalam Vimala Menon honoured with Padma Shri
item.description: She has been honoured for her contributions in propagating as well as revitalising classical dances, especially Mohiniyattam.

item.title: K.T. Thomas conferred Padma Vibhushan award
Shubhanshu Shukla awarded Ashoka Chakra
item.description: Shubhanshu Shukla became the second Indian to go to space and the first one to set foot on the ISS as part of the Axiom-4 mission

item.description: Six political parties wrote to the Chief Electoral Officer, alleging that a large number of fake objections were filed against voters without the knowledge of the listed objectors

Brinda Karat calls on women to drive away BJP-RSS, protect Constitution
item.description: At AIDWA meet, she calls for nationwide movement to restore MGNREGA, stressing its role in providing livelihood security to crores of rural poor, especially women
